title: Elon Musk lifts political ad ban on X
description: The ban was originally put in place at Twitter to thwart misinformation. X said in a blog post that allowing political ads was 'building on our commitment to free expression.'

title: Two migrants surviving the treacherous Tunisian-Algerian border
description: Driven out of Tunisia and pushed back several times by Algerian soldiers in the middle of the desert, Alpha Oumar and Ibrahima long for just one thing: to return home to Guinea.

title: Les Bleus eliminated from the FIBA World Cup just one year before the Olympics
description: Despite their victory over Lebanon on Tuesday in Jakarta, France has been eliminated in the first round after defeats to Canada and Latvia. Just one year before the Paris Olympics, the French national team has a lot to consider.

title: DRC: Militia group kills at least 14 people
description: The northeastern region of the DRC continues to bear the brunt of violence as the CODECO rebel group perpetrates yet another deadly attack.

title: 'This is more than a game for us. It's a Ukrainian national product': Behind the scenes of 'S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2.'
description: Ukrainian studio GSC Game World presented its highly-anticipated game to the public at Gamescom, the Cologne video game fair. Its employees tell 'Le Monde' how they are staying the course despite the war.

title: World economy shows signs of slowdown
description: Rising interest rates are beginning to affect the business cycle, set to slow in Europe and the US in the second half of this year.

title: Brussels' Midi station is plagued by crime and unsanitary conditions
description: The gateway to Belgium, which sees 50,000 travellers passing through every day, is suffering from an often inefficient division of powers between the federal state, regions and municipalities.

title: Memorial for Yevgeny Prigozhin held in private
description: The Wagner chief died last week in a private jet crash along with nine other people, two months after ordering his troops to topple Russia's military leadership.

title: Meloni's government is deadlocked on how to control migration
description: The rate at which migrants arrive on the Italian island of Lampedusa continues to rise, despite Rome's neighborhood policy.

title: Massive northeastern Greece wildfire persists for 11th day
description: Currently, 74 blazes are raging throughout the country. The Alexandroupolis and Evros wildfire is the biggest in the EU since record keeping started in 2000.

title: The US's industry is picking up as Europe's struggles
description: On the back of cheaper energy, colossal subsidies, and tax credits, factory openings are multiplying in the United States.

title: Large-scale Chinese disinformation campaign dismantled by Meta
description: Dubbed Spamouflage, this large-scale operation used thousands of accounts and pages to criticize the United States and the West, as well as to extol Beijing's virtues.

title: Fukushima: Beyond contaminated water lies enormous challenges of dismantling plant
description: The main challenge at the site is to extract the nearly 880 tonnes of fuel that have melted in three of the six reactors, the precise state of which is not known.

title: Ban on abayas in schools reopens the French left's historic split on secularism
description: France's far-left party La France Insoumise has announced its intention to appeal the ban, a government measure supported by some Socialists and the Communists.

title: A gentle retreat in Corsica
description: At the entrance to Cap Corse, 300 meters above the sea, the Couvent de Pozzo, a convent built in the 15th century, is a guest house steeped in history, providing a welcoming place to stay along with regional fare.

title: Germany drops sexual assault probe into Rammstein frontman
description: Prosecutors said the investigation into sexual assault allegations against Rammstein leader singer Till Lindemann had been dropped, citing a lack of evidence.

title: French soldier killed in Iraq 'anti-terrorist' operation
description: An elite French commando member was killed on Monday while taking part in an 'anti-terrorist' operation, the French presidency said.

title: What is the abaya, the garment France wants to ban from schools?
description: France's education minister is seeking to ban the traditional over-garment on the grounds that it is an ostensibly religious symbol.

title: A bright summer for French tourism
description: Despite fluctuating weather conditions as well as inflation, the picture in France is very positive thanks to foreign tourists. But domestic visitor numbers are beginning to falter.

title: Pakistan court suspends ex-PM Khan's graft sentence
description: A spokesman for Khan's party said the Islamabad High Court had overturned a lower court's decision to imprison him for three years, a verdict that barred him from contesting upcoming elections.

title: Gabon awaits election results, and a potential repetition of its 2016 protests
description: The country was placed under curfew and Internet access was cut off once voting ended last week. The first voting trends provided by civil society observers put the main opposition candidate in the lead.

title: Jet streams: The strong high altitude winds that could trigger heat waves
description: 'The Earth's pulses' (5/6). Strong upper-level winds, or jet streams, worry specialists concerned about the effect of their combination with global warming. In Europe, they could contribute to heat waves in particular.

title: Libya's foreign minister flees after Israel meeting sparks uproar
description: The secret meeting, which took place in Rome, did not go down well in Libya, a country that does not recognize the existence of Israel.

title: Macron maintains firm stance toward junta in Niger, risking confrontation
description: The French president is banking on divisions among the putschists, but his position could quickly become untenable if the military remains in power.

title: 'Lights out' Djokovic cruises on US Open return
description: The Serbian tennis star is set to take back the world number-one ranking from Carlos Alcaraz at the end of the tournament.

title: Japanese embassy in China says 'extremely worried' over Fukushima harassment
description: Chinese people had thrown bricks at Tokyo's embassy in Beijing and made harassing phone calls over Tokyo's release of treated wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear plant.

title: The crucial timetable of Trump's legal battles
description: In the proceedings related to the Capitol assault, the federal trial of the former US president has been set for March 4, 2024, one day before Super Tuesday, when a dozen primaries will be held for the November presidential election.

title: The Barrière Group, a French 'Succession' story
description: In April, 36-year-old Alexandre Barrière, son of Dominique Desseigne and Diane Barrière, brutally ousted his father from the management of the group of casinos, luxury hotels and restaurants.

title: Guatemala's presidential election winner faces uncertainty as his party gets suspended
description: After being declared the winner of the country's presidential election on Monday, progressive Bernardo Arévalo's Seed Movement party was suspended from all activities by another government body.

title: Eminem tells Vivek Ramaswamy to stop using his music on campaign trail
description: Earlier this month, the Republican presidential candidate performed the Detroit rap star's famous song 'Lose Yourself' at the Iowa State Fair.

title: Xi Jinping calls for the 'normalization' and assimilation of Uyghur autonomous region
description: Visiting Xinjiang on Saturday, President Xi called for the 'social stability' of the province, which has been the scene of an intense crackdown that has interned over 1 million Uyghurs and Muslim minorities in re-education camps.

title: Cameroon bans 'Barbie' movie for not corresponding with country's values
description: After a month in theaters, Yaoundé chose to censor Greta Gerwig's film due to its alleged promotion of homosexuality, an act that is punishable by six months' imprisonment under Cameroonian law.
